dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3389 RH: Emergency Wildfire Fighting Technology Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Valadao (for himself, Mr. Costa, Mr. Amodei, Mr. Issa, Mr. Newhouse, Mr. Curtis, and Mr. Lamborn) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources, and in addition to the Committee on Agriculture, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned
Additional sponsors: Mr. Mike Garcia of California, Mr. Kiley, and Mr. Harder of California
Reported from the Committee on Natural Resources with an amendment
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

action.action-desc: Committee on Agriculture discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on May 16, 2023

form.official-title: To require the Secretary of Agriculture, acting through the Chief of the Forest Service, and the Secretary of the Interior to conduct an evaluation with respect to the use of the container aerial firefighting system (CAFFS), and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Emergency Wildfire Fighting Technology Act of 2023.

subsection.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of the Interior, in consultation with the National Interagency Aviation Committee and the Interagency Airtanker Board, shall jointly conduct an evaluation of the container aerial firefighting system to assess the use of such system to mitigate and suppress wildfires.

Not later than 120 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary of the Interior, in consultation with the National Interagency Aviation Committee and the Interagency Airtanker Board, shall jointly submit to the appropriate committees a report that includes the results of the evaluation required under subsection (a).
In this section, the term appropriate committees means—

paragraph.text: the Committees on Agriculture and Natural Resources of the House of Representatives; and
the Committees on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry and Energy and Natural Resources of the Senate.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported from the Committee on Natural Resources with an amendment
Committee on Agriculture discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
